intro: Caylusea hexagyna var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed caylusea, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, glabrous stems and lanceolate leaves with a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color, blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires a humid, shaded environment to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
